intro: Corryocactus quivillanus, commonly known as the Andean torch cactus, is a species native to the high altitudes of the Andes Mountains. It is characterized by its columnar, spiny stems that can grow up to several meters in height. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the summer months, which are borne in clusters at the top of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid regions.
